name: Hamamelis virginica
Relationship: Compare in hemorrhoids: CALC. FLUOR.; ALOE; MUR-AC. in varicose veins. MANGIFERA INDICA.Complementary: FERRUM.Compare: ARNICA, CALEN.; TRILLIUM; BELLIS; SULPH-AC.; PULSATILLA.Antidote: ARNICA.

Eyes: Painful weakness; sore pain in eyes; bloodshot appearance; inflamed vessels greatly injected
Head: Feeling as of a bolt from temple to temple
Fullness, followed by epistaxis
Numbness over frontal bone
Wants the respect due to me shown
Back: Severe pain in lumbar and hypogastric region, extending down legs
Nose: Bleeding from nose profuse; flow passive, non-coagulable, with tightness in bridge of nose
Female: Metrorrhagia, occurring midway between menstrual periods
Menses dark, profuse, with soreness in abdomen
Uterine hemorrhage, bearing-down pain in back
Milk-leg, hemorrhoids, and sore nipples, after confinement
Ovarian congestion and neuralgia; feel very sore
Vaginismus, ovaritis, soreness over whole abdomen
Skin: Varicose veins and ulcers; very sore
Throat: Mucous membrane distended and bluish; varicosis of throat
Extremities: Tired feeling in arms and legs
Chilliness in back and hips, extending down legs
Male: Pain in spermatic cord, running into testes

details: Venous congestion, hemorrhages, varicose veins, and hemorrhoids, with BRUISED SORENESS OF AFFECTED PARTS, seem to be the special sphere of this remedy. Acts upon the coats of the veins causing relaxation with consequent engorgement. Passive venous hemorrhages from any part. Great value in open, painful wounds, with weakness from loss of blood. After operations, super cedes the use of morphia (Helmuth).
dosage: Tincture, to sixth attenuation. Distilled extract locally.
